member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Interaction.WindowsSystemDispatcherQueueHelper.CreateDispatcherQueueController(SudokuStudio.Interaction.WindowsSystemDispatcherQueueHelper.DispatcherQueueOptions,System.Object@)
member.summary: Creates a . Use the created to create and manage the lifetime of a to run queued tasks in priority order on the dispatcher queue's thread.
member.param: The threading affinity and type of COM apartment for the created . See remarks for details.
member.returns: S_OK for success; otherwise a failure code.

remarks.para: If .threadType is DQTYPE_THREAD_DEDICATED, then this function creates a thread, initializes it with the specified COM apartment, and associates a with that thread. The dispatcher queue event loop runs on the new dedicated thread until the dispatcher queue is explicitly shut down. To avoid thread and memory leaks, call when you are finished with the dispatcher queue.

If .threadType is DQTYPE_THREAD_CURRENT, then a is created and associated with the current thread. An error results if there is already a associated with the current thread. The current thread must pump messages to allow the dispatcher queue to dispatch tasks. Before the current thread exits, it must call , and continue pumping messages until the completes.
This call does not return until the and new thread (if any) are created.

Important
The , and its associated , are WinRT objects. See their documentation for usage details.

member.summary: Specifies whether to initialize the COM apartment on the new thread as an application single-threaded apartment (ASTA) or a single-threaded apartment (STA). This field is relevant only if threadType is DQTYPE_THREAD_DEDICATED. Use DQTAT_COM_NONE when is DQTYPE_THREAD_CURRENT.

summary.para: Provides with the type that contains a module initializer method, called automatically by the CLR (Common Language Runtime) to initialize some values.

para.i: The type is called by the compiler and the CLR (Common Language Runtime), which means you cannot use any members in this type manually.

target.name: method
target.summary: Called by the runtime automatically while booting on this solution to initialize the values, data members or any other things that can or should be initialized here.
target.remarks: The concept module is different with assembly. The solution can contain multiple assemblies, while each assembly can contain multiple modules. However, due to the design of Visual Studio project file system, each assembly will only contain one module by default.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This page can modify bottleneck concept, in order to change the searching rules to calculate bottlenecks..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.BottleneckSettingPage_EliminationGroupDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Elimination group: If there's a list of steps before an assignment step, the last one will be considered as bottlenecks.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.BottleneckSettingPage_HardestLevelDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Hardest level: Choose one or more steps having the hardest difficulty level, as bottlenecks.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.BottleneckSettingPage_HardestRatingDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Hardest rating: Choose one or more steps having the largest number of difficulty rating value, as bottlenecks.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.BottleneckSettingPage_SequentialInversionDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Sequential inversion: If there's a pair of adjacent steps, and former is harder (has a harder difficulty level), latter is easier (a easier difficulty level), then the former will be treated as bottleneck.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.BottleneckSettingPage_SingleStepOnlyDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unique conclusion: If there's a step, whose corresponding grid state only contains one available step, and the puzzle cannot continue unless the step should be applied, the step will be considered as bottlenecks.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.BottleneckSettingPage_SingleStepSameLevelOnlyDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unique conclusion same difficulty level: Same as Unique conclusion rule, but it will ignore higher difficulty rating rule if checking avilable steps.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Indicates whether the difficulty rating value defined by Sudoku Explainer will be displayed in the step shown in solving path tab. If the current technique is not defined in Sudoku Explainer, a string "SER" in light white will be displayed as a placeholder; if HoDoKu rating will be also displayed, Sudoku Explainer rating will be shown right-side of the HoDoKu rating.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DirectHiddenSubsetMaxSizeDescription

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DirectNakedSubsetMaxSizeDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Sometimes subsets whose size greater than 2 are not "direct". This option can control with this in searching for Direct Naked Subsets. This option only works with direct techniques (mentioned above this option). The suggested value is 2, and the maximum value is 4..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Disable for Finned X-Wings & Sashimi X-Wings.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DisableFinnedOrSashimiXWingDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Grouped & non-grouped Skyscrapers are equivalent to X-Wings, but some users may be used to spotting for skyscrapers and grouped skyscrapers instead of finned or sashimi X-Wings. This option can disable for Finned X-Wings & Sashimi X-Wings..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DisableGroupedTurbotFishDescription

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DisableSudokuPaneLayoutDisplaying

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DisplayCandidatesForPuzzles
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Candidate displaying.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DisplayCandidatesForPuzzlesDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Due to unknown information of candidate visibility, we cannot determine which kind of candidate displaying case is good. This option gives you some options you can control for this behavior..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DisplayCursorsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Cursors are a group of highlighted cells that describes what cell your cursor point points to..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DisplayCursorsTitle
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Display for cursors.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DistinctDirectAndIndirectModes
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Distinct direct and indirect modes.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DistinctDirectAndIndirectModesDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This option controls the case whether the program will display candidates. If all candidates are displayed, we can re-order the searching logic (making naked singles before hidden singles) to make the solving and analysis experience better. Hidden subsets will be also re-arranged in this option. However, this option will not take any effect if ittoryu settings are enabled (because ittoryu modes are used in ONLY direct views)..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DistinctWithDeltaDigitsDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to In a puzzle with a unique solution, the program can check whether the digits input (deleted) is correct. If this option is on, the program will use another color to display wrong conclusions..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_DistinctWithDeltaDigitsTitle
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Distinct with delta digits.

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If this option is set true, when you adjust state of the sudoku grid pane, you can see animation (such as candidates ease in/out). Such animations are called "Animation Feedback"..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableCornerRadiusForSudokuPanes

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableDoubleTapFillingForSudokuPane
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Enable double tapping to fill digit.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableDoubleTapFillingForSudokuPaneDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If this option is enabled, when you double-clicked a candidate (requiring displaying candidates), the digit can be automatically input into the cell. In addition, some sudoku panels in some pages may not be related to this option because of not displaying of candidates..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableFullHouse
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Enable technique "Full House".

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableFullHouseDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If disabled, the technique that uses only one house with only one cell being empty will be treated as naked single.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableLastDigit
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Enable technique "Last Digit".

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableOrderingStepsByLastingValue
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Lasting value has priority.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableOrderingStepsByLastingValueDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Substitute the step ordering rule, making steps with lower lasting value firstly being checked while ordering steps. For example, search steps with lasting value 2, and then lasting 3, and lasting 4, etc...

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableOrderingStepsByLastingValueDescription2
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to By default, searching module will strictly checks for technique used. For example, Naked Singles is harder than Hidden Single, and Hidden Single is harder than Last Digit, and Last Digit is harder than Full House..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableRightTapRemovingForSudokuPane
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Enable right tapping to remove digit.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_EnableRightTapRemovingForSudokuPaneDescription

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_StepSearcherOrderingDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This option controls the ordering of step-searching. For example, if you put "Subsets" before "Locked Candidates", subset-related steps will have a higher priority to be searched. If you disable it, it will be really disabled in step-searching. In addition, we recommend you NOT disable or re-order some important step searchers..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Strong link dash style.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SettingsPage_StrongLinkDashStyleDescription
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Please input a series of digits, indicating the dash style of a chain link. Digits are the length of all split sub-lines. For example, "3,2" means a dotted line with contain several periods of two sub-lines, with lengths 3 and 2. You can keep the text box be empty, which means the line will not use dotted rule to separate it with multiple parts..

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Resources.SudokuStudioResources.SingleCountingPracticingPage_Intro
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This page offers you a sudoku grid to practice techniques "Naked Single" and "Full House". You can get experienced from this page. The puzzle will generate some puzzles and display them one by one, you should input the result inside the sudoku pane. No matter whether your answer is correct, program will go to the next puzzle. When you answer the specified number of puzzles, the game will be automatically over, and calculates the result..

member.name: T:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.Interoperability
member.summary: Provides with a set of methods that is defined as native methods (written by other programming languages such as C++).

member.name: T:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3
member.summary: Extends ITaskbarList2 by exposing methods that support the unified launching and switching taskbar button functionality added in Windows 7. This functionality includes thumbnail representations and switch targets based on individual tabs in a tabbed application, thumbnail toolbars, notification and status overlays, and progress indicators.
member.remarks: See this link to learn more information about this interface.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.HrInit
member.summary: Initializes the taskbar list object. This method must be called before any other ITaskbarList methods can be called.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.AddTab(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Adds an item to the taskbar.
member.param: A handle to the window to be added to the taskbar.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.DeleteTab(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Deletes an item from the taskbar.
member.param: A handle to the window to be deleted from the taskbar.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.ActivateTab(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Activates an item on the taskbar. The window is not actually activated; the window's item on the taskbar is merely displayed as active.
member.param: A handle to the window on the taskbar to be displayed as active.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.SetActiveAlt(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Marks a taskbar item as active but does not visually activate it.
member.param: A handle to the window to be marked as active.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.MarkFullscreenWindow(System.IntPtr,System.Int32)
member.summary: Marks a window as full-screen

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.SetProgressValue(System.IntPtr,System.UInt64,System.UInt64)
member.summary: Displays or updates a progress bar hosted in a taskbar button to show the specific percentage completed of the full operation.
member.param: The handle of the window whose associated taskbar button is being used as a progress indicator.
An application-defined value that indicates the proportion of the operation that has been completed at the time the method is called.
An application-defined value that specifies the value ullCompleted will have when the operation is complete.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.SetProgressState(System.IntPtr,SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.TBPFLAG)
member.summary: Sets the type and state of the progress indicator displayed on a taskbar button.
member.param: The handle of the window in which the progress of an operation is being shown. This window's associated taskbar button will display the progress bar.
Flags that control the current state of the progress button. Specify only one of the following flags; all states are mutually exclusive of all others.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.RegisterTab(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Informs the taskbar that a new tab or document thumbnail has been provided for display in an application's taskbar group flyout.
member.param: Handle of the tab or document window. This value is required and cannot be NULL.
Handle of the application's main window. This value tells the taskbar which application's preview group to attach the new thumbnail to. This value is required and cannot be NULL.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.UnregisterTab(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Removes a thumbnail from an application's preview group when that tab or document is closed in the application.
member.param: The handle of the tab window whose thumbnail is being removed. This is the same value with which the thumbnail was registered as part the group through ITaskbarList3::RegisterTab. This value is required and cannot be NULL.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.SetTabOrder(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Inserts a new thumbnail into a tabbed-document interface (TDI) or multiple-document interface (MDI) application's group flyout or moves an existing thumbnail to a new position in the application's group.
member.param: The handle of the tab window whose thumbnail is being placed. This value is required, must already be registered through ITaskbarList3::RegisterTab, and cannot be NULL.

The handle of the tab window whose thumbnail that hwndTab is inserted to the left of. This handle must already be registered through ITaskbarList3::RegisterTab. If this value is NULL, the new thumbnail is added to the end of the list.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.SetTabActive(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Informs the taskbar that a tab or document window has been made the active window.
member.param: Handle of the active tab window. This handle must already be registered through ITaskbarList3::RegisterTab. This value can be NULL if no tab is active.
Handle of the application's main window. This value tells the taskbar which group the thumbnail is a member of. This value is required and cannot be NULL.
None, one, or both of the following values that specify a thumbnail and peek view to use in place of a representation of the specific tab or document.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.ThumbBarAddButtons(System.IntPtr,System.UInt32,SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTON[])
member.summary: Adds a thumbnail toolbar with a specified set of buttons to the thumbnail image of a window in a taskbar button flyout.
member.param: The handle of the window whose thumbnail representation will receive the toolbar. This handle must belong to the calling process.
The number of buttons defined in the array pointed to by pButton. The maximum number of buttons allowed is 7.

A pointer to an array of THUMBBUTTON structures. Each THUMBBUTTON defines an individual button to be added to the toolbar. Buttons cannot be added or deleted later, so this must be the full defined set. Buttons also cannot be reordered, so their order in the array, which is the order in which they are displayed left to right, will be their permanent order.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.ThumbBarSetImageList(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Specifies an image list that contains button images for a toolbar embedded in a thumbnail image of a window in a taskbar button flyout.
member.param: The handle of the window whose thumbnail representation contains the toolbar to be updated. This handle must belong to the calling process.
The handle of the image list that contains all button images to be used in the toolbar.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.SetOverlayIcon(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Applies an overlay to a taskbar button to indicate application status or a notification to the user.
member.param: The handle of the window whose associated taskbar button receives the overlay. This handle must belong to a calling process associated with the button's application and must be a valid HWND or the call is ignored.

The handle of an icon to use as the overlay. This should be a small icon, measuring 16x16 pixels at 96 dots per inch (dpi). If an overlay icon is already applied to the taskbar button, that existing overlay is replaced.
A pointer to a string that provides an alt text version of the information conveyed by the overlay, for accessibility purposes.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.SetThumbnailTooltip(System.IntPtr,System.String)
member.summary: Specifies or updates the text of the tooltip that is displayed when the mouse pointer rests on an individual preview thumbnail in a taskbar button flyout.
member.param: The handle to the window whose thumbnail displays the tooltip. This handle must belong to the calling process.
The pointer to the text to be displayed in the tooltip. This value can be NULL, in which case the title of the window specified by hwnd is used as the tooltip.

member.name: M:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.ITaskbarList3.SetThumbnailClip(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Selects a portion of a window's client area to display as that window's thumbnail in the taskbar.
member.param: The handle to a window represented in the taskbar.

A pointer to a RECT structure that specifies a selection within the window's client area, relative to the upper-left corner of that client area. To clear a clip that is already in place and return to the default display of the thumbnail, set this parameter to NULL.

member.name: T:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.MonitorDpiType
member.summary: Identifies the dots per inch (dpi) setting for a monitor.

remarks.para: All of these settings are affected by the PROCESS_DPI_AWARENESS of your application.

summary.para: Value: 0
The effective DPI. This value should be used when determining the correct scale factor for scaling UI elements. This incorporates the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.
Value: 1
The angular DPI. This DPI ensures rendering at a compliant angular resolution on the screen. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display.
Value: 2

The raw DPI. This value is the linear DPI of the screen as measured on the screen itself. Use this value when you want to read the pixel density and not the recommended scaling setting. This does not include the scale factor set by the user for this specific display and is not guaranteed to be a supported DPI value.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.MonitorDpiType.MDT_Default
member.summary: The default DPI setting for a monitor is .

member.summary: Try to set state on the specified window.

member.summary: Try to set progress value on the specified window.

member.name: T:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.TBPFLAG
member.summary: Represents a flag that describes for a taskbar progress state.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.TBPFLAG.TBPF_NOPROGRESS
member.summary: Stops displaying progress and returns the button to its normal state. Call this method with this flag to dismiss the progress bar when the operation is complete or canceled.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.TBPFLAG.TBPF_INDETERMINATE
member.summary: The progress indicator does not grow in size, but cycles repeatedly along the length of the taskbar button. This indicates activity without specifying what proportion of the progress is complete. Progress is taking place, but there is no prediction as to how long the operation will take.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.TBPFLAG.TBPF_NORMAL
member.summary: The progress indicator grows in size from left to right in proportion to the estimated amount of the operation completed. This is a determinate progress indicator; a prediction is being made as to the duration of the operation.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.TBPFLAG.TBPF_ERROR
member.summary: The progress indicator turns red to show that an error has occurred in one of the windows that is broadcasting progress. This is a determinate state. If the progress indicator is in the indeterminate state, it switches to a red determinate display of a generic percentage not indicative of actual progress.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.TBPFLAG.TBPF_PAUSED
member.summary: The progress indicator turns yellow to show that progress is currently stopped in one of the windows but can be resumed by the user. No error condition exists and nothing is preventing the progress from continuing. This is a determinate state. If the progress indicator is in the indeterminate state, it switches to a yellow determinate display of a generic percentage not indicative of actual progress.

member.name: T:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTON
member.summary: Used by methods of the interface to define buttons used in a toolbar embedded in a window's thumbnail representation.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTON.dwMask
member.summary: A combination of values that specify which members of this structure contain valid data; other members are ignored, with the exception of , which is always required.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTON.iId
member.summary: The application-defined identifier of the button, unique within the toolbar.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTON.iBitmap
member.summary: The zero-based index of the button image within the image list set through .

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTON.hIcon
member.summary: The handle of an icon to use as the button image.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTON.szTip
member.summary: A wide character array that contains the text of the button's tooltip, displayed when the mouse pointer hovers over the button.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTON.dwFlags
member.summary: A combination of values that control specific states and behaviors of the button.

member.name: T:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTONFLAGS
member.summary: Used by to control specific states and behaviors of the button.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTONFLAGS.THBF_ENABLED
member.summary: The button is active and available to the user.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTONFLAGS.THBF_DISABLED
member.summary: The button is disabled. It is present, but has a visual state that indicates that it will not respond to user action.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTONFLAGS.THBF_DISMISSONCLICK
member.summary: When the button is clicked, the taskbar button's flyout closes immediately.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTONFLAGS.THBF_NOBACKGROUND
member.summary: Do not draw a button border, use only the image.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTONFLAGS.THBF_HIDDEN
member.summary: The button is not shown to the user.

member.name: F:SudokuStudio.Runtime.InteropServices.THUMBBUTTONFLAGS.THBF_NONINTERACTIVE
member.summary: The button is enabled but not interactive; no pressed button state is drawn. This value is intended for instances where the button is used in a notification.

member.summary: Indicates whether the pane prevent the simple conflict, which means, if you input a digit that is conflict with the Digits in its containing houses, this pane will do nothing by this value being . If not, the pane won't check for any conflict and always allow you inputting the digit regardless of possible conflict.

member.name: P:SudokuStudio.Views.Pages.SingleCountingPracticingPage.SelectedMode
member.summary:
Indicates the selection mode. The value is as follows:
Value Meaning
0 Indicates the generator generates the puzzle that only uses row/column/block 5.
1 Indicates the generator generates the puzzle that relies on full houses.
2 Indicates the generator generates the puzzle that relies on naked singles.
3 Indicates both selection 1 and 2.

summary.para: Provides with a project-wide window manager type, as a helper class type.
This helper class to allow the app to find the Window that contains an arbitrary (GetWindowForElement). To do this, we keep track of all active s.
The app code must call rather than " ()" expression so we can keep track of all the relevant windows.
In the future, we would like to support this in platform APIs.

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.CloseHandle(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HANDLE)
member.summary: Closes an open object handle.
member.param: A valid handle to an open object.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, the return value is nonzero. If the function fails, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError. If the application is running under a debugger, the function will throw an exception if it receives either a handle value that is not valid or a pseudo-handle value. This can happen if you close a handle twice, or if you call CloseHandle on a handle returned by the FindFirstFile function instead of calling the FindClose function.

remarks.para: The CloseHandle function closes handles to the following objects:

member.name: M:Windows.Win32.PInvoke.GetDpiForWindow(Windows.Win32.Foundation.HWND)
member.summary: Returns the dots per inch (dpi) value for the specified window.
member.param: The window that you want to get information about.
member.returns: The DPI for the window, which depends on the [DPI_AWARENESS](/windows/win32/api/windef/ne-windef-dpi_awareness) of the window. See the **Remarks** section for more information. An invalid *hwnd* value will result in a return value of 0.

remarks.para: The following table indicates the return value of GetDpiForWindow based on the [DPI_AWARENESS](/windows/win32/api/windef/ne-windef-dpi_awareness) of the provided *hwnd*.
